CLI to create a new Docus project:
language-bash shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme material-theme-palenight
You can choose between two templates:
: Basic Docus setup for single-language documentation
: Includes internationalization support for multi-language documentation

# Create with i18n template
npx create-docus my-docs -t i18n
Start your docs server in development
Move to your docs directory and start your docs server in development mode:
A local preview of your documentation will be available at
section to learn how to write your documentation.

Create a new project on Nuxt Studio
From your user or team dashboard, click the
Clone it on your GitHub personal account or any organisation of your choice.
Once your project has been created and you're in the project dashboard, navigate to the
) in the environment variables then click on the
This is a one click static deployment available with
but you can also handle deployment yourself and use the
Write your documentation in the editor
Once the deployment is achieved, you'll be able to display the preview of your documentation. You can browse your content pages to edit them or create new ones.
If you want to try Docus and Nuxt Studio in develoment mode without an UI Pro license, you can check the Nuxt Content documentation for local setup with Nuxt Studio.
